meanings.sent1: I miscalculate the answer on my math test.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to miscalculate the total cost of your groceries.
meanings.sent3: He always seems to miscalculate the time it takes to get ready.
meanings.sent4: Her plan to arrive early miscalculated the traffic during rush hour.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's miscalculate led to an unexpected result in the experiment.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake in estimating or predicting.
meanings.sent1: They miscalculate the number of guests coming to the party.
meanings.sent2: It's easy to miscalculate how long it will take to finish a project.
meanings.sent3: The weather forecast miscalculated the chance of rain today.
meanings.sent4: She miscalculated the impact of her words on her friend's feelings.
meanings.sent5: The explorer's miscalculate about the distance to the next town left them lost in the wilderness.
